meanings.definition: To make a loud noise or disturbance.
meanings.sent1: The children began to roup loudly during the game.
meanings.sent2: The thunder rouped through the night, waking everyone up.
meanings.sent3: The rambunctious puppy decided to roup up the quiet library.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident rouped through the small town like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock rouped me out of bed with its shrill sound.

meanings.sent1: The sudden roup startled the birds in the trees.
meanings.sent2: The construction site was filled with the constant roup of machinery.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected roup of laughter echoed in the empty hallway.
meanings.sent4: The roup of the fire alarm sent everyone into a panic.
meanings.sent5: The roup of the thunderstorm made the windows shake.

meanings.definition: To gather or huddle together closely.
meanings.sent1: The family decided to roup together for warmth around the campfire.
meanings.sent2: The penguins roup together to protect themselves from the cold winds.
meanings.sent3: The friends roup together to plan a surprise party for their classmate.
meanings.sent4: The sheep roup together in the corner of the field during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The students roup together to study for the upcoming exam.

meanings.definition: A group or gathering of people or animals.
meanings.sent1: The roup of protesters marched down the street, chanting slogans.
meanings.sent2: The roup of geese flew in a V formation across the sky.
meanings.sent3: The roup of friends enjoyed a picnic in the park on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The roup of students eagerly awaited the start of the school trip.
meanings.sent5: The roup of cows grazed peacefully in the meadow.
